author: sibkatya
content:
with these params and new network params including `eip7805_fork_epoch: 3` it worked  fine until  8 epoch. Then I had missed blocks on one of the validators and errors like these:

```
[vc-2-geth-prysm] time="2025-01-28 11:55:58" level=error msg="Failed to request block from beacon node" error="rpc error: code = Internal desc = could not build block in parallel: rpc error: code = Internal desc = Could not get local payload: could not prepare payload: timeout from http.Client" prefix=client pubkey=0x93f99442b2c3 slot=338

[cl-2-prysm-geth] time="2025-01-28 12:03:58" level=error msg="Finished building block" error="rpc error: code = Internal desc = Could not get local payload: could not prepare payload: timeout from http.Client" prefix="rpc/validator" sinceSlotStartTime=8.563282674s slot=378 validator=318
```

I saved log files if needed

author: sibkatya
content:
Images are built from `prysm/fosil` and  `jihoon/focil`, updated today's morning.

Config file:
```
participants_matrix:
  el:
    - el_type: geth
      el_image: geth-focil:latest
  cl:
    - cl_type: prysm
      cl_image: gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:latest
      vc_type: prysm
      vc_image: gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/validator:latest
      count: 2
      cl_log_level: debug

network_params:
  electra_fork_epoch: 1
  fulu_fork_epoch: 2
  eip7805_fork_epoch: 3
  min_validator_withdrawability_delay: 1
  shard_committee_period: 1
  churn_limit_quotient: 16
  preregistered_validator_count: 512
  num_validator_keys_per_node: 256

additional_services:
  - dora
  - tx_spammer
  - prometheus_grafana

dora_params:
  image: ethpandaops/dora:fulu-support
```

author: nc1234
content: Lodestar's bn pre-computes IL Committee and ILC roots every epoch https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/blob/ec9fecc7b6526994a7327a06ce47f99a9704c8ea/packages/state-transition/src/util/epochShuffling.ts#L150, similar to beacon committee. And it will send these duty info through `getInclusionListCommitteeDuties` endpoint. VC caches them, and the only thing missing for vc to sign an IL is the IL transactions, which will be returned by `produceInclusionList` <@363800010518822915>

author: terencechain
content: I think this is good. I dont see anything wrong with it. I was worried about reorging that could change the root but dont really think this is an issue, if there's a reorg large enough, the vc should be calling get duties again and recache the il committee root values...

author: nflaig
content: if dependant root of duties changes you have to refetch anyways, added a note in the spec https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/490/files#diff-ceb4d08d1cb30c34a9a58b27ad023c417ed6eb3c35235c5848c67039e5403fc0R9-R22 but I am guess this is what client already do for attestation duties
